programme.title: Shot Caller
programme.desc: A California stockbroker is arrested and charged for a fatal DUI accident, and on his lawyer's advice, takes a plea deal which sees him sentenced to 16 months in prison. While incarcerated, he becomes involved with a violent white supremacist gang.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television so that viewers can order the items they want directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television so that viewers can order the items they want directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment.

programme.title: Ice Age: Collision Course
programme.desc: The herd must leave their home and find a safe shelter after they notice a giant asteroid from outer space is hurtling towards Earth.

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Marmee is the head of the March household in the absence of her husband, who's away fighting in the US Civil War. Her daughters range from the headstrong Jo and sweet Beth, to domesticated Meg and wilful Amy. The film follows the trials and tribulations of the girls, from early poverty and tragedy to Jo's later efforts to secure both a husband and a successful writing career, and Amy's relationship with an old family friend.

programme.title: Flushed Away
programme.desc: A spoiled but lonely pet rat gets flushed down the toilet and finds himself stranded in London's sewer underworld. A savvy scavenger helps him evade frog assassins, but his attempts to help escalate the conflict put them both in deadly danger.

programme.title: A Dog's Purpose
programme.desc: Reincarnated as different dogs over the course of five decades, a lovable and devoted canine keeps reuniting with the original owner who cared for it as a young golden retriever puppy.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: The British Empire's greatest adventurer, Allan Quatermain, is enlisted to battle masked criminal Fantom. Quatermain needs help, and calls up a band of celebrated heroes: vampiress Mina, Dr Jekyll and the Invisible Man.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III
programme.desc: Now a trainer for IMF recruits, an elite intelligence agent squares off against the toughest foe he has ever faced: a ruthless arms and information broker. Can the retired super spy defeat a psychotic arms dealer and save the world without his new lady love finding out his secret past?

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: A family must navigate their lives in silence to avoid mysterious creatures that hunt by sound. Knowing that even the slightest whisper or footstep can bring death, a couple protect their children while desperately searching for a way to fight back.

programme.title: The Witch
programme.desc: In 1630 New England, panic and despair envelops a farmer, his wife and their children when youngest son Samuel suddenly vanishes. The family blames Thomasin, the oldest daughter who was watching the boy at the time of his disappearance.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television so that viewers can order the items they want directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television so that viewers can order the items they want directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment.

programme.title: Carry on Regardless
programme.desc: The gang set up an agency that aims to come to the rescue of people with unusual problems. Needless to say, they manage to get into plenty of scrapes during the course of their jobs, which include walking a chimpanzee, modelling underwear and guarding the employees of a strip club.

programme.title: The Book of Life
programme.desc: In the Mexican town of San Angel, Manolo, Maria and Joaquin have been friends ever since childhood. Although their lives have taken different paths: Maria was sent to Europe, Joaquin joined the military, and Manolo studied to become a bullfighter. One thing remains the same: Manolo and Joaquin both want to marry Maria. Little does the trio know that battling husband-and-wife deities have made a high-stakes wager on the love triangle's outcome.

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon
programme.desc: A young Viking with aspirations of becoming a dragon hunter befriends a young dragon himself and learns more about the creatures than he ever assumed.

programme.title: Night at the Museum 2
programme.desc: When his museum friends claim that four of history's greatest villains have come to life, the former night guard returns to save the world.

programme.title: Entrapment
programme.desc: An unlikely partnership is formed by an insurance investigator and an ageing cat burglar. When a heavily guarded work of art is stolen, the insurance investigator persuades her employers to let her go undercover and team up with a master thief. The thief sets the woman a rigorous training programme before they embark on a series of robberies against an emotional backdrop of distrust and growing attraction.

Earth's billions of inhabitants are unaware that the planet has an expiration date. With the warnings of an American scientist, world leaders begin secret preparations for the survival of select members of society. When the global cataclysm finally occurs, failed writer Jackson Curtis tries to lead his family to safety as the world starts falling apart.

programme.title: Titane Interview Special
programme.desc: Titane Interview Special.

programme.title: 47 Metres Down
programme.desc: Two sisters vacationing in Mexico become trapped in a shark cage on the ocean floor. As their oxygen starts to run out and with great white sharks circling them, the sisters must find a way to get to the surface alive.

programme.title: Me and You and Everyone We Know
programme.desc: Christine Jesperson is a struggling artist who meets divorced father-of-two Richard Swersey. There's a mutual attraction between them, but she moves too fast and what could have been an easy relationship, takes time to re-establish itself.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television so that viewers can order the items they want directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television so that viewers can order the items they want directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment.

programme.title: BSL Zone
programme.desc: Angus and Vikram are having a dating contest, with Fred as referee. It's supposed to be for fun, but it could get serious. Tim is nervous about his date with Madeline, and asks the other men for their help.

programme.title: Arabian Nights
programme.desc: Two brothers vie for the title of Caliph of Baghdad and the hand of Scheherazade the dancer. When the dancer is told that he she will marry the Caliph, there is a coup.

programme.title: Attack!
programme.desc: Powerful, uncompromising and controversial screen adaptation of Norman Brooks' play, `The Fragile Fox'. In Belgium in 1944, a cowardly captain is endangering the lives of his men, but the Colonel is unwilling to act. As a result, Lieutenant Joe Costa suffers heavy losses and sets out for the Captain's blood.

programme.title: The Duel at Silver Creek
programme.desc: A gang of cowboy cutthroats terrorise the honest gold prospectors of a small frontier town. When they slaughter the sheriff's oldest friend, he deputises the dead man's son - otherwise known as the Silver Kid. Together they swear to wreak their vengeance, unaware that the brains behind the outfit is a woman.

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth
programme.desc: Myles Falworth, the son of a disgraced knight, is determined to prove himself. With the help of the Earl of Mackworth and despite the sneers of his contemporaries, he trains for his knighthood and finally earns his spurs and the nation's thanks when he foils a plot to de-throne King Henry IV. His love interest is Lady Anne Mackworth, while the Earl of Alban is the requisite baddie that Falworth must overcome.

programme.title: The Electrical Life Of Louis Wain Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpe's eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain.

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: Andy is a recent college graduate with big dreams. Upon landing a job at prestigious Runway magazine, she finds herself the assistant to diabolical editor Miranda Priestly. Andy questions her ability to survive her grim tour as Miranda's whipping girl without getting scorched.

programme.title: Last Orders
programme.desc: Touching depiction of a group of lifelong friends who gather together after the death of one of their number, a London butcher. The remaining friends embark on a trip to scatter his ashes in the place where he wished to retire and, as the journey progresses, they each reflect on the impact their deceased friend had on their lives.

programme.title: Foresight
programme.desc: Zaid, recently released from prison for an unknown crime, tries to reintegrate into his previous life, only to find that the arms of the state can control what he says and does.

programme.title: The Ritual
programme.desc: Reuniting after the tragic death of their friend, four college friends set out to hike through the Scandinavian wilderness. But a wrong turn leads them into the mysterious forests of Norse legend, where an ancient evil stalks them at every turn.

programme.title: White God
programme.desc: Failing in his efforts to find his beloved owner, an abandoned dog eventually joins a canine revolt against their human abusers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Presenting the latest products live on television so that viewers can order the items they want directly. The product range extends from vacuum cleaners and bath towels to sports equipment.

programme.title: Anne of the Thousand Days
programme.desc: Henry VIII of England discards one wife, Katharine of Aragon, who has failed to produce a male heir, in favour of the young and beautiful Anne Boleyn.

programme.title: The Electrical Life Of Louis Wain Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpe's eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain.

programme.title: Captain Scarlett
programme.desc: An eponymous nobleman returns home from the Napoleonic Wars only to find the evil Duke de Corlaine has stolen his lands and is oppressing his people. With the help of Pierre DuCloux, he forms a gang of outlaws to fight injustice, finding time along the way to rescue the beautiful Princess Maria from the clutches of the wicked Count Villiers.

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: The holiday of an American doctor and his family turns into a nightmare when they get caught up in a plot to assassinate a politician. When their son is kidnapped, the doctor and his wife follow the trail to London.

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Mikaela and Sam once again join forces with Optimus Prime again to save Earth from ruthless robot The Fallen.

programme.title: Taken 3
programme.desc: Ex-covert operative Bryan Mills and his ex-wife, Lenore, are enjoying a reconciliation when Lenore is brutally murdered. Bryan is framed for the crime and flees, with the CIA, FBI and police all in hot pursuit. For the last time, he channels his rage and particular set of skills into hunting down Lenore's real killers, taking his revenge and protecting the one important thing left in his life: his daughter, Kim.

programme.title: Foresight
programme.desc: Two unaccompanied brothers embark on a journey to a new settlement on the moon planet Titan. Their interactions reflect the subtle naivety and anxious fear that this huge moment means for each of them amid an industrial-sized group of migrants.

programme.title: Monsters and Men
programme.desc: A bystander films the death of a black man at the hands of police, which sparks rising tensions in a New York neighbourhood as some are moved to take a stand.

programme.title: Lawrence Jones Cross Country
programme.desc: Hosted by Jones Lawrence, a new focus on the political and cultural situation with key stories such as the COVID pandemic and the border crisis.

But a standoff cannot last forever, especially with the fate of the cafe and Koji's asylum status hanging in the balance.

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: DS Ronnie Brooks and DS Matt Devlin investigate a shocking crime in which a man is attacked and has his kidney removed. Suspecting organ trafficking, they discover that the kidney was earmarked to be transplanted into a wealthy recipient. When the case comes to court, Crown Prosecutors James Steele and Alesha Phillips are surprised to find a familiar face leading the defence team.

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Ronnie and Matt are surprised when a middle-class white girl who is found dead turns out to have been a drug mule. Her parents are distraught and baffled, but the investigation reveals that the perfect daughter who was about to go to university also had a secret life. There is a mysterious boyfriend nobody ever met and there are rumours of an active sex life and a coke dealer who disappeared.

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: After a farewell party for departing flatmate Eleanor, Jo and Chrissy are anxious to find a third girl to share but find cookery student Robin Tripp in the bath instead.

programme.title: Emmerdale Omnibus
programme.desc: Manpreet visits Meena. Charity and Chas are still not seeing eye to eye. Rhona's shocked when her mum arrives out of the blue.

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: An unsolved case returns to haunt Frost when a man is found hanged in his apartment, but according to police records, the victim died over a year before.

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: When an environmental health officer disappears and a dismembered arm is washed up on the shore of the Humber Estuary, Frost is called in to investigate. Suspecting foul play he links the murder to a meat factory the health officer had been looking into. Frost also has troubles on the home front with the arrival of his new lodger and his uninvited dog.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When a wealthy banker disappears on a walk from his country mansion to the village post office, Poirot bets Inspector Japp that he can solve the mystery without leaving his apartment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman slips away from a camp site where a Jane Austen fantasy event is taking place dressed in period attire, and is found stabbed in the woods with a quill, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter discover that the victim was a journalist interested in the village's healthcare drone delivery programme, and are forced to look back in time to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Winter uncover multiple motives when the winner of a fought-after music award is found strangled with a violin string moments before a performance, including a rivalry over the prize and a missing Stradivarius.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby joins a trip from Midsomer Parva to Brighton because he's suspicious about a deal to buy coastal land for holiday chalets by Causton's mayor. Also against the proposal is Lady Matilda William, a descendant of a French knight Sir Richard Guillaume, whose son Richard will be the last of the line because of brain damage sustained in an attack 20 years ago.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Featuring two women looking for answers to questions that have haunted them for decades. Firstly, a woman who made a discovery as a teenager that changed her life and secondly, a mother longing to find the son she felt she let down as a baby.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Unseen Adventures

programme.title: Maigret

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: DS Ronnie Brooks agrees to help his old friend and partner DS Jimmy Valentine in an undercover drugs sting, but tragedy strikes when an innocent bystander is shot dead. programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When a young child is murdered, the CCTV footage of the boy being led to his death haunts both the police officers and legal team involved in the case. However, with nothing but rumours to go on, a murder charge cannot be issued.

programme.title: Black College Quiz Show
programme.desc: This half-hour show pits students from -- historically -- Black colleges and universities across the country against one another in challenges that test the contestants' knowledge of African-American history. The weekly series hosted by radio personality Nephew Tommy awards scholarships to the schools of participating students. Prior to becoming a weekly series in late 2013, the competition was featured in annual specials during Black History Month and awarded more than $500,000 in scholarships to more than 50 schools. Participating institutions include Tuskegee, Howard, and Grambling State universities.

programme.title: New: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: Rocket Fuel: Hondo's mum tests the SWAT team leader and Chris weighs up a big decision. Tan's personal ties to a case emerge. (S2, ep 20)

programme.title: New: Grimm
programme.desc: Over My Dead Body: Nick must go against his instincts to save Monroe after an old friend arrives with the news that she has been sent to kill him. (S2, ep 6)

programme.title: Killer Families
programme.desc: Kara Lounsbury: When a beloved businessman's daughter is accused of his murder, she makes a terrible accusation of her own

programme.title: The Survivalist
programme.desc: A year and a half after the fall of civilization due to a viral outbreak, a former FBI agent is forced to protect a young woman immune to the disease from a dangerous gang leader hunting her.

programme.title: Old Henry
programme.desc: A quiet man and his son take in a wounded stranger near his homestead, along with a bag full of cash. The stranger claims he's a sheriff being pursued by outlaws, but the man can't be sure.

programme.title: Snake Eyes
programme.desc: Detective Rick Santoro (Nicolas Cage) has never played by the rules. When he attends a high-profile boxing match with his friend Navy Cmdr. Kevin Dunne (Gary Sinise), as well as Defense Secretary Kirkland (Joel Fabiani), he witnesses a terrorist assassinate Kirkland. Despite a lockdown on the arena, key witness Julia Costello (Carla Gugino) escapes -- and Santoro begins to suspect Kirkland's death is part of a much larger conspiracy that involves boxing rivals and a beautiful stranger.

programme.title: Bellator MMA
programme.desc: Adam Borics vs. Mads Burnell, featherweight bout; Phil Davis vs. Julius Anglickas, light heavyweight bout. From The Family Arena in St. Louis.

programme.title: LX 2048
programme.desc: A terminally ill man tries to secure the future of his family in a world where the toxicity of the sun forces people to stay inside during the daytime.

programme.title: Friday the 13th - Part III
programme.desc: The third installment in the "Friday the 13th" series picks up on the day after the carnage with homicidal maniac Jason Voorhees (Richard Brooker) stealing some clothes and killing a local store owner. Meanwhile, Chris (Dana Kimmell) and her sometimes boyfriend, Rick (Paul Kratka), are hosting a group of teenage friends at Chris' lake house. Despite a run-in with a local biker gang, they enjoy an amiable weekend together -- that is, until Jason begins knocking off kids and bikers alike.

programme.title: The Challenger
programme.desc: With help from a legendary trainer (Michael Clarke Duncan), a New York boxer (Kent Moran) returns to the ring to fight his way to a better life.

programme.title: Alien
programme.desc: In deep space, the crew of the commercial starship Nostromo is awakened from their cryo-sleep capsules halfway through their journey home to investigate a distress call from an alien vessel. The terror begins when the crew encounters a nest of eggs inside the alien ship. An organism from inside an egg leaps out and attaches itself to one of the crew, causing him to fall into a coma.

programme.title: Mine 9
programme.desc: Miners struggle to survive after an explosion leaves them trapped two miles underground.

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: Caleb Smith (Domhnall Gleeson) a programmer at a huge Internet company, wins a contest that enables him to spend a week at the private estate of Nathan Bateman (Oscar Isaac), his firm's brilliant CEO. When he arrives, Caleb learns that he has been chosen to be the human component in a Turing Test to determine the capabilities and consciousness of Ava (Alicia Vikander), a beautiful robot. However, it soon becomes evident that Ava is far more self-aware and deceptive than either man imagined.

programme.title: Aeon Flux
programme.desc: In the 25th century, the Earth's population has dwindled to a surviving five million following a devastating virus that almost resulted in the extinction of all human life 400 years earlier. Confined to one city-state, a group of rebels, led by Handler (Frances McDormand), seeks to destroy the oppressive government -- first, by assassinating a high-ranking chairman (Marton Csokas). Tasked with this mission, Aeon Flux (Charlize Theron) must integrate herself in a world of deceit and mystery.

programme.title: Byzantium
programme.desc: Mayhem follows when two female vampires (Gemma Arterton, Saoirse Ronan), on the run from a kindred group, take refuge at a seaside British community.

programme.title: Werewolves Within
programme.desc: A snowstorm traps town residents together inside the local inn, where newly arrived forest ranger Finn and postal worker Cecily must try to keep the peace and uncover the truth behind a mysterious creature that has begun terrorizing the community.

programme.title: Alien
programme.desc: In deep space, the crew of the commercial starship Nostromo is awakened from their cryo-sleep capsules halfway through their journey home to investigate a distress call from an alien vessel. The terror begins when the crew encounters a nest of eggs inside the alien ship. An organism from inside an egg leaps out and attaches itself to one of the crew, causing him to fall into a coma.

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: After floating in space for 57 years, Lt. Ripley's (Sigourney Weaver) shuttle is found by a deep space salvage team. Upon arriving at LV-426, the marines find only one survivor, a nine year old girl named Newt (Carrie Henn). But even these battle-hardened marines with all the latest weaponry are no match for the hundreds of aliens that have invaded the colony.

programme.title: The Babysitter
programme.desc: Jennifer (Alicia Silverstone) is a lovely teen who has been hired to baby-sit the kids of Harry Tucker (J.T. Walsh) and his wife, Dolly (Lee Garlington). The Tuckers go to a party and proceed to get inebriated, with Mr. Tucker fantasizing about his beautiful baby sitter. Meanwhile, Jack (Jeremy London), her boyfriend, and Mark (Nicky Katt), another guy interested in her, decide to spy on Jennifer at the Tucker house, with each young man also fixated on her.

programme.title: Embattled
programme.desc: The eldest son of a ruthlessly tough MMA champion must fight his way out of the abusive cycle his father has continued.

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: A woman (Charlize Theron) confronts traumatic, childhood memories of the murder of her mother and two sisters when she investigates the possibility that her brother (Corey Stoll) is innocent of the crime.

programme.title: The Man in the Iron Mask
programme.desc: The former musketeer Athos (John Malkovich) swears vengeance after despotic King Louis XIV (Leonardo DiCaprio) causes the death of his son. Summoning his old comrades Porthos (GÃ©rard Depardieu) and Aramis (Jeremy Irons), he hatches a plan to liberate a shackled prisoner rumored to be the king's twin brother, and then install him on the throne. But the three musketeers must also contend with their old friend D'Artagnan (Gabriel Byrne), who has remained in the king's service.

programme.title: Ricky Powell: The Individualist
programme.desc: Photographer Ricky Powell captures the music, fashion and art scene in New York City in the 1980s and '90s.

programme.title: Good Time
programme.desc: A bank robber stops at nothing to free his brother from prison, launching himself into a nightlong odyssey through New York's dark and dangerous criminal underworld.

programme.title: The Gentlemen
programme.desc: Mickey Pearson is an American expatriate who became rich by building a highly profitable marijuana empire in London. When word gets out that he's looking to cash out of the business, it soon triggers an array of plots and schemes -- including bribery and blackmail -- from shady characters who want to steal his domain.

programme.title: The Ballad of Lefty Brown
programme.desc: A merciless cowboy sets out on a dangerous journey across the frontier, determined to do whatever it takes to avenge his longtime partner's brutal murder.

programme.title: Serpico
programme.desc: Frank Serpico (Al Pacino) is an idealistic New York City cop who refuses to take bribes, unlike the rest of the force. His actions get Frank shunned by the other officers, and often placed in dangerous situations by his partners. When his superiors ignore Frank's accusations of corruption, he decides to go public with the allegations. Although this causes the Knapp Commission to investigate his claims, Frank has also placed a target on himself. The film is based on a true story.

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Crooked cops on the take -- small-time drug lords -- sleazy informers and sadistic rich kids ready to kill --- for police detective John Shaft, its just another night in the underbelly of New York City, another shift facing down cops and criminals who want him dead and a legal system that thrives on money, not justice.

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc: In 2002, cable news producer Kim Barker (Tina Fey) decides to shake up her routine by taking a daring new assignment in Kabul, Afghanistan. Dislodged from her comfortable American lifestyle, Barker finds herself in the middle of an out-of-control war zone. Luckily, she meets Tanya Vanderpoel (Margot Robbie), a fellow journalist who takes the shellshocked reporter under her wing. Amid the militants, warlords and nighttime partying, Barker discovers the key to becoming a successful correspondent.

programme.title: Bellator MMA
programme.desc: Adam Borics vs. Mads Burnell, featherweight bout; Phil Davis vs. Julius Anglickas, light heavyweight bout. From The Family Arena in St. Louis.

programme.title: High Life
programme.desc: Monte and his baby daughter are the last survivors of a damned and dangerous mission to the outer reaches of the solar system. They must now rely on each other to survive as they hurtle toward the oblivion of a black hole.

programme.title: Billions
programme.desc: After the Commission's decision, Prince encourages his team to find new investments as Wendy prepares for the future; Taylor goes all-in on a questionable play; Rian comes to an unlikely arrangement with Wags.

programme.title: Desus & Mero
programme.desc: Correspondents Rainey and Tawanda see whether Desus & Mero can tell if strangers on the street are really from New York; Denzel Washington.

programme.title: The Ballad of Lefty Brown
programme.desc: A merciless cowboy sets out on a dangerous journey across the frontier, determined to do whatever it takes to avenge his longtime partner's brutal murder.

programme.title: Semper Fi
programme.desc: Cal is a dedicated cop who also serves as a sergeant in the Marine Corps Reserve. When his reckless half brother lands in jail for accidentally killing a man, Cal and his buddies hatch a plan to break him out of prison -- no matter what the cost.

programme.title: A Most Violent Year
programme.desc: In 1981 New York, a fuel supplier (Oscar Isaac) tries to adhere to his own moral compass amid the rampant violence, corruption and decay that threaten his family and his business.

programme.title: Detainee 001
programme.desc: The complex legal story of John Walker Lindh, a young American who fell under the spell of the Taliban in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Paradise Cove
programme.desc: A deranged homeless woman terrorizes a man and his wife as they try to renovate his late mother's beach house in Malibu, Calif.

programme.title: Beneath a Sea of Lights
programme.desc: A billboard repairman's life spirals out of control when he meets a con artist in Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

programme.title: Gunfight at Dry River
programme.desc: In the Old West, a family of renegades controls the only water source in a Mexican border town ravaged by severe drought. However, when a stranger arrives to reclaim his father's land, a violent confrontation changes all of their lives forever.

programme.title: The Guest
programme.desc: A string of mysterious deaths leads a teenager to become suspicious of a soldier (Dan Stevens) who showed up on her family's doorstep and claimed to be a friend of her dead brother.

programme.title: Snake Eyes
programme.desc: Detective Rick Santoro (Nicolas Cage) has never played by the rules. When he attends a high-profile boxing match with his friend Navy Cmdr. Kevin Dunne (Gary Sinise), as well as Defense Secretary Kirkland (Joel Fabiani), he witnesses a terrorist assassinate Kirkland. Despite a lockdown on the arena, key witness Julia Costello (Carla Gugino) escapes -- and Santoro begins to suspect Kirkland's death is part of a much larger conspiracy that involves boxing rivals and a beautiful stranger.

programme.title: Wrong Turn
programme.desc: Despite warnings to stick to the Appalachian Trail, hikers stray off course and cross into land inhabited by a hidden community of mountain dwellers who use deadly means to protect their way of life. Suddenly under siege, the friends seem headed to the point of no return -- unless one man can reach them in time.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: All the boxing action.

programme.title: Best of Showtime Boxing 2021
programme.desc: Taking another look at some of the year's top moments in boxing.

programme.title: Pulp Fiction
programme.desc: Vincent Vega (John Travolta) and Jules Winnfield (Samuel L. Jackson) are hitmen with a penchant for philosophical discussions. In this ultra-hip, multi-strand crime movie, their storyline is interwoven with those of their boss, gangster Marsellus Wallace (Ving Rhames) ; his actress wife, Mia (Uma Thurman) ; struggling boxer Butch Coolidge (Bruce Willis) ; master fixer Winston Wolfe (Harvey Keitel) and a nervous pair of armed robbers, "Pumpkin" (Tim Roth) and "Honey Bunny" (Amanda Plummer).

programme.title: Sacrifice
programme.desc: A New Yorker and his pregnant wife return to the Norwegian village of his birth to claim an unexpected inheritance. They soon find themselves in a living nightmare when they encounter a sinister cult that worships a sea-dwelling deity.

programme.title: Slow West
programme.desc: A bounty hunter (Michael Fassbender) keeps his true motive a secret from the naive Scottish teenager (Kodi Smit-McPhee) he's offered to serve as bodyguard and guide while the youth searches for his beloved in 1800s Colorado.

programme.title: Seabiscuit
programme.desc: In the midst of the Great Depression, a businessman (Jeff Bridges) coping with the tragic death of his son, a jockey with a history of brutal injuries (Tobey Maguire) and a down-and-out horse trainer (Chris Cooper) team up to help Seabiscuit, a temperamental, undersized racehorse. At first the horse struggles to win, but eventually Seabiscuit becomes one of the most successful thoroughbreds of all time, and inspires a nation at a time when it needs it most.

programme.title: No Man's Land
programme.desc: When a vigilante border patrol turns fatal, a man flees on horseback to Mexico, seeking forgiveness from the victim's father.

programme.title: Locke
programme.desc: A man's (Tom Hardy) life unravels after he leaves a construction site at a critical time and drives to London to be present for the birth of a child conceived during a one-night stand.

programme.title: Kobe Bryant's Muse
programme.desc: An unprecedented level of access reveals the life and career of NBA player Kobe Bryant as he tries to cement his legacy and contemplates his life after sports.

programme.title: Aquarium of the Dead
programme.desc: Sea creatures in an aquarium become zombies after a scientific accident.

programme.title: The Survivalist
programme.desc: A year and a half after the fall of civilization due to a viral outbreak, a former FBI agent is forced to protect a young woman immune to the disease from a dangerous gang leader hunting her.

programme.title: Seabiscuit

At first the horse struggles to win, but eventually Seabiscuit becomes one of the most successful thoroughbreds of all time, and inspires a nation at a time when it needs it most.

programme.title: The Djinn
programme.desc: A mute boy becomes trapped in his apartment with a sinister monster after making a wish to fulfill his heart's greatest desire.

programme.title: The Djinn
programme.desc: A mute boy becomes trapped in his apartment with a sinister monster after making a wish to fulfill his heart's greatest desire.

programme.desc: A snowstorm traps town residents together inside the local inn, where newly arrived forest ranger Finn and postal worker Cecily must try to keep the peace and uncover the truth behind a mysterious creature that has begun terrorizing the community.

programme.title: The Bling Ring
programme.desc: A teenager (Israel Broussard) and his gang of fame-obsessed youths (Katie Chang, Taissa Farmiga) use the Internet to track the whereabouts of celebrities, then rob their homes.

programme.title: Eighth Grade
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old Kayla endures the tidal wave of contemporary suburban adolescence as she makes her way through the last week of middle school -- the end of her thus far disastrous eighth-grade year.

programme.title: Obvious Child
programme.desc: An immature, newly unemployed comic (Jenny Slate) must navigate the murky waters of adulthood after her fling with a graduate student (Jake Lacy) results in an unplanned pregnancy.

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: Four local Berliners recruit a thrill-seeking Spanish woman (Laia Costa) to be their getaway driver for a bank robbery.

programme.title: Support the Girls
programme.desc: Lisa is the general manager of Double Whammies, a sports bar that features skimpily dressed waitresses. Always nurturing and protective of her staff, she soon faces one trying day that tests her optimism at every turn.

programme.title: Letters to Juliet
programme.desc: While visiting Verona, Italy, with her busy fiance, a young woman named Sophie (Amanda Seyfried) visits a wall where the heartbroken leave notes to Shakespeare's tragic heroine, Juliet Capulet. Finding one such letter from 1957, Sophie decides to write to its now elderly author, Claire (Vanessa Redgrave). Inspired by Sophie's actions, Claire sets out to find her long-lost lover, accompanied by her disapproving grandson (Christopher Egan) and Sophie.

programme.title: After Yang
programme.desc: When his young daughter's beloved companion -- an android named Yang -- malfunctions, Jake searches for a way to repair it. In the process, Jake discovers the life that has been passing in front of him as he reconnects with his wife and daughter.

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc: In 2002, cable news producer Kim Barker (Tina Fey) decides to shake up her routine by taking a daring new assignment in Kabul, Afghanistan. Dislodged from her comfortable American lifestyle, Barker finds herself in the middle of an out-of-control war zone. Luckily, she meets Tanya Vanderpoel (Margot Robbie), a fellow journalist who takes the shellshocked reporter under her wing. Amid the militants, warlords and nighttime partying, Barker discovers the key to becoming a successful correspondent.

programme.title: Reds
programme.desc: American journalist John Reed (Warren Beatty) journeys to Russia to document the Boleshevik Revolution and returns a revolutionary. His fervor for left-wing politics leads him to Louise Bryant (Diane Keaton), then married, who will become a feminist icon and activist. Politics at home become more complicated as the rift grows between reality and Reed's ideals. Bryant takes up with a cynical playwright (Jack Nicholson), and Reed returns to Russia, where his health declines.

programme.title: The Mauritanian
programme.desc: A defense attorney, her associate and a military prosecutor uncover a far-reaching conspiracy while investigating the case of a suspected 9/11 terrorist imprisoned at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, for six years.

programme.title: The Survivalist
programme.desc: A year and a half after the fall of civilization due to a viral outbreak, a former FBI agent is forced to protect a young woman immune to the disease from a dangerous gang leader hunting her.

programme.title: The Survivalist
programme.desc: A year and a half after the fall of civilization due to a viral outbreak, a former FBI agent is forced to protect a young woman immune to the disease from a dangerous gang leader hunting her.

programme.title: No Man's Land
programme.desc: When a vigilante border patrol turns fatal, a man flees on horseback to Mexico, seeking forgiveness from the victim's father.

programme.title: Menashe
programme.desc: Deep in the heart of New York's notoriously secretive Hasidic Jewish community, Menashe, a good-hearted but somewhat hapless grocery store clerk, struggles against tradition to keep custody of his only son after his wife passes away.

programme.title: Ms. Purple
programme.desc: A karaoke hostess reconnects with her estranged brother, forcing them to enter a period of intense self-reflection as their single father who raised them nears death.

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: A look at three defining chapters in the life of Chiron, a young black man growing up in Miami. His epic journey to manhood is guided by the kindness, support and love of the community that helps raise him.

programme.title: Mississippi Burning
programme.desc: When a group of civil rights workers goes missing in a small Mississippi town, FBI agents Alan Ward (Willem Dafoe) and Rupert Anderson (Gene Hackman) are sent in to investigate. Local authorities refuse to cooperate with them, and the African American community is afraid to, precipitating a clash between the two agents over strategy. As the situation becomes more volatile, the direct approach is abandoned in favor of more aggressive, hard-line tactics.

programme.title: Mojave
programme.desc: A down-and-out artist (Garrett Hedlund) has a dangerous and shocking encounter with an evil drifter (Oscar Isaac) in the desert, leading to terrifying consequences when the deadly stranger follows his unsuspecting victim home.

programme.title: Delivery Man
programme.desc: Amiable slacker David Wozniak (Vince Vaughn) drives a delivery truck for his family's company and is content with a life of mediocrity. However, when he learns that he is the biological father of more than 500 offspring and many of them are suing to learn his identity, he decides to hold himself accountable for his actions. He finds some of his progeny and becomes involved in their lives; however, when David's girlfriend announces her pregnancy, she keeps her expectations low.

programme.title: Empire Records
programme.desc: Joe (Anthony LaPaglia) runs Empire Records, an independent Delaware store that employs a tight-knit group of music-savvy youths. Hearing that the shop may be sold to a big chain, slacker employee Lucas (Rory Cochrane) bets a chunk of the store's money, hoping to get a big return. When this plan fails, Empire Records falls into serious trouble, and the various other clerks, including lovely Corey (Liv Tyler) and gloomy Deb (Robin Tunney), must deal with the problem, among many other issues.

programme.title: Mainstream
programme.desc: A young woman finds a path to internet stardom when she starts making videos with a charismatic stranger.

programme.title: The Diary of a Teenage Girl
programme.desc: In 1970s San Francisco, a precocious 15-year-old (Bel Powley) embarks on an enthusiastic sexual odyssey, beginning with her mother's current lover (Alexander SkarsgÃ¥rd).

programme.title: LX 2048
programme.desc: A terminally ill man tries to secure the future of his family in a world where the toxicity of the sun forces people to stay inside during the daytime.

programme.title: What's Eating Gilbert Grape
programme.desc: Gilbert Grape (Johnny Depp) is a small-town young man with a lot of responsibility. Chief among his concerns are his mother (Darlene Cates), who is so overweight that she can't leave the house, and his mentally impaired younger brother, Arnie (Leonardo DiCaprio), who has a knack for finding trouble. Settled into a job at a grocery store and an ongoing affair with local woman Betty Carver (Mary Steenburgen), Gilbert finally has his life shaken up by the free-spirited Becky (Juliette Lewis).

programme.title: Moonlight
programme.desc: A look at three defining chapters in the life of Chiron, a young black man growing up in Miami. His epic journey to manhood is guided by the kindness, support and love of the community that helps raise him.

programme.title: Beat the Devil
programme.desc: Ralph Fiennes stars in a one-man show about playwright David Hare and his experience with COVID-19.

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: A federal agent investigates the decades-old death of a teenage girl in his drought-stricken hometown.

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Mike Sullivan (Tom Hanks) is an enforcer for powerful Depression-era Midwestern mobster John Rooney (Paul Newman). Rooney's son, Connor (Daniel Craig), is jealous of the close bond they share, and when Mike's eldest son, Michael (Tyler Hoechlin), witnesses a hit, Connor uses the incident as an excuse to murder Sullivan's wife (Jennifer Jason Leigh) and youngest son. Forced to flee, Sullivan and Michael set out on a journey of revenge and self-discovery.

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: Fearing it would compromise his career, lawyer Andrew Beckett (Tom Hanks) hides his homosexuality and HIV status at a powerful Philadelphia law firm. But his secret is exposed when a colleague spots the illness's telltale lesions. Fired shortly afterwards, Beckett resolves to sue for discrimination, teaming up with Joe Miller (Denzel Washington), the only lawyer willing to help. In court, they face one of his ex-employer's top litigators, Belinda Conine (Mary Steenburgen).

programme.title: Dark Waters
programme.desc: A tenacious attorney uncovers a dark secret that connects a growing number of unexplained deaths to one of the world's largest corporations. While trying to expose the truth, he soon finds himself risking his future, his family and his own life.

programme.title: 16 Shots
programme.desc: A Chicago police officer is charged with murder after the shooting of Laquan McDonald.

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: A federal agent investigates the decades-old death of a teenage girl in his drought-stricken hometown.

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Mike Sullivan (Tom Hanks) is an enforcer for powerful Depression-era Midwestern mobster John Rooney (Paul Newman). Rooney's son, Connor (Daniel Craig), is jealous of the close bond they share, and when Mike's eldest son, Michael (Tyler Hoechlin), witnesses a hit, Connor uses the incident as an excuse to murder Sullivan's wife (Jennifer Jason Leigh) and youngest son. Forced to flee, Sullivan and Michael set out on a journey of revenge and self-discovery.

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: Fearing it would compromise his career, lawyer Andrew Beckett (Tom Hanks) hides his homosexuality and HIV status at a powerful Philadelphia law firm. But his secret is exposed when a colleague spots the illness's telltale lesions. Fired shortly afterwards, Beckett resolves to sue for discrimination, teaming up with Joe Miller (Denzel Washington), the only lawyer willing to help. In court, they face one of his ex-employer's top litigators, Belinda Conine (Mary Steenburgen).

programme.title: Monday
programme.desc: When Mickey is introduced to Chloe one hot summer night in Athens, the attraction between the pair is immediately palpable -- so palpable that before they know it they're waking up naked on the beach on Saturday morning.

programme.title: Dark Waters
programme.desc: A tenacious attorney uncovers a dark secret that connects a growing number of unexplained deaths to one of the world's largest corporations. While trying to expose the truth, he soon finds himself risking his future, his family and his own life.

programme.title: Flirting With Disaster
programme.desc: Adopted as a child, new father Mel Colpin (Ben Stiller) decides he cannot name his son until he knows his birth parents, and determines to make a cross-country quest to find them. Accompanied by his wife, Nancy (Patricia Arquette), and an inept yet gorgeous adoption agent, Tina (Tea Leoni), he departs on an epic road trip that quickly devolves into a farce of mistaken identities, wrong turns, and overzealous and love-struck ATF agents (Josh Brolin, Richard Jenkins).

programme.title: Grace and Grit
programme.desc: Illness and unexpected challenges threaten to tear apart the relationship between philosopher Ken Wilber and the woman he loves.

programme.title: Boys and Girls
programme.desc: Ryan and Jennifer are opposites who definitely do not attract. At least that's what they always believed. When they met as twelve-year-olds, they disliked one another. When they met again as teenagers, they loathed each other. But when they meet in college, the uptight Ryan and the free-spirited Jennifer find that their differences bind them together and a rare friendship develops.

programme.title: Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy
programme.desc: In 1970s England the head of MI6, Control (John Hurt), dispatches an agent (Mark Strong) to meet with a Hungarian general who knows the identity of a Soviet spy in the organization's ranks. However, the mission goes wrong, and the general dies before he can reveal the information. Undersecretary Oliver Lacon (Simon McBurney) calls veteran agent George Smiley (Gary Oldman) back from forced retirement to ferret out the mole and stop the flow of vital British secrets to the Russians.

programme.title: Guest Artist
programme.desc: A young man explores the tangled relationship between the dreams of youth and the wisdom of age when he meets his hero, a bitter playwright.

programme.title: Indecent Proposal
programme.desc: David (Woody Harrelson) and Diana Murphy (Demi Moore) are a loving couple with a bright future. David is a talented architect; Diana is a top-notch real estate agent. But when the recession hits, their finances take a nosedive. In a last-ditch effort to save their dream home, they head to Las Vegas to win their mortgage money gambling. After they lose everything, a mysterious billionaire (Robert Redford) offers the solution to their money problems: $1 million -- if he can sleep with Diana.

programme.title: American Beauty
programme.desc: Lester Burnham (Kevin Spacey) is a gainfully employed suburban husband and father. Fed up with his boring, stagnant existence, he quits his job and decides to reinvent himself as a pot-smoking, responsibility-shirking teenager. What follows is at once cynical, hysterical, and, eventually, tragically uplifting.

programme.title: The Ballad of Lefty Brown

programme.title: The Hallelujah Trail
programme.desc: As the winter of 1867 approaches, Denver inhabitants led by chronic drunk Oracle Jones (Donald Pleasence), who has visions when inebriated, realize with horror that their supply of whiskey will run out before the snows melt. Oracle devises a plan to bring cases of whiskey from a distillery, but is thwarted at every turn. A temperance leader (Lee Remick), three Sioux Indians, and the U.S. Cavalry become interested in the shipment, and a sandstorm and quicksand add to the difficulties.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: Bounty hunter Ben Brigade (Randolph Scott) is on his way to California with his prisoner, Billy John (James Best), who is unaware that Brigade is really after his brother, Frank (Lee Van Cleef). The pair stop at a frontier post and and find themselves defending the poorly guarded settlement from a Native American assault. When the widow Mrs. Lane (Karen Steele) decides to accompany them to Santa Cruz, Brigade enlists the aid of two outlaws who may have a hidden agenda of their own.

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: Wealthy rancher Sampson Drune (Charles Bickford) is resented by members of the Romer family, who feel he swindled them out of their cattle. They retaliate by robbing Drune and fleeing with the money. Drune organizes a posse of townspeople and asks alcoholic Sheriff John Frazier (Broderick Crawford) to deputize the group. They head out in search of the bandits with Frazier in tow. Two days later, the Romers and Drune are dead, Frazier is wounded and the money has disappeared.

programme.title: Across the Wide Missouri
programme.desc: Tough trapper Flint Mitchell (Clark Gable) is a tenacious survivor in the unforgiving wilderness of the West. Determined to stay on the good side of the local Blackfoot tribe, Flint is intent on marrying Kamiah (Maria Elena Marques), the beautiful daughter of Ironshirt (Ricardo Montalban) -- especially since this union would allow him to freely pursue his trade in the region. Struggling to win the approval of the protective Ironshirt, Flint finds himself truly falling for Kamiah.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Following an 11-year stay as a buffalo hunter in Kansas, Jonas Trapp (Chuck Connors) is finally on the way home to his wife, Jessie (Kathryn Hays), with the $17,000 he has saved up. Unfortunately, he happens to run into a group of bandits led by Brooks Durham (Michael Rennie) ; they beat him, brand him and steal all of his money. Now, returning home without a dollar to his name, Jonas finds Jessie has moved on to another man -- namely, Brooks Durham.

programme.title: Brave Warrior
programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: Wealthy rancher Sampson Drune (Charles Bickford) is resented by members of the Romer family, who feel he swindled them out of their cattle. They retaliate by robbing Drune and fleeing with the money. Drune organizes a posse of townspeople and asks alcoholic Sheriff John Frazier (Broderick Crawford) to deputize the group. They head out in search of the bandits with Frazier in tow. Two days later, the Romers and Drune are dead, Frazier is wounded and the money has disappeared.

programme.title: The Return of Frank James
programme.desc: When Jesse James's murderers are set free, his brother Frank vows revenge and, accompanied by his gang, sets out to track them down. To fund his manhunt, he robs an express office and is subsequently wrongly accused of the clerk's murder, but a newspaper reporter is determined to find out the truth.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Following an 11-year stay as a buffalo hunter in Kansas, Jonas Trapp (Chuck Connors) is finally on the way home to his wife, Jessie (Kathryn Hays), with the $17,000 he has saved up. Unfortunately, he happens to run into a group of bandits led by Brooks Durham (Michael Rennie) ; they beat him, brand him and steal all of his money. Now, returning home without a dollar to his name, Jonas finds Jessie has moved on to another man -- namely, Brooks Durham.

programme.title: Two Flags West
programme.desc: A captured Rebel colonel (Joseph Cotten) and his men are posted at a Union commander's (Jeff Chandler) fort in Indian country.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: A man whose life was saved by an outlaw shows his gratitude by reluctantly assisting in a stagecoach robbery.

programme.title: The Bravos
programme.desc: A cavalry outpost commander's troubles increase after a precarious truce dissolves and his young son is kidnapped.

programme.title: Across the Wide Missouri
programme.desc: Tough trapper Flint Mitchell (Clark Gable) is a tenacious survivor in the unforgiving wilderness of the West. Determined to stay on the good side of the local Blackfoot tribe, Flint is intent on marrying Kamiah (Maria Elena Marques), the beautiful daughter of Ironshirt (Ricardo Montalban) -- especially since this union would allow him to freely pursue his trade in the region. Struggling to win the approval of the protective Ironshirt, Flint finds himself truly falling for Kamiah.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The luck of Pat Brennan (Randolph Scott) is about to go from bad to worse; after gambling his horse away, he gets a ride from Willard (John Hubbard) and Doretta Mims (Maureen O'Sullivan). Soon, their stagecoach is hijacked by a trio of merciless bandits, led by the especially heartless Frank Usher (Richard Boone). As Usher holds the coach passengers hostage, Brennan falls in love with Doretta and develops a risky plan to free himself and the Mimses, leading to a bloody final standoff.

programme.title: Across the Wide Missouri
programme.desc: Tough trapper Flint Mitchell (Clark Gable) is a tenacious survivor in the unforgiving wilderness of the West. programme.title: The Ox-Bow Incident
programme.desc: In this classic Western, wanderers Gil Carter (Henry Fonda) and Art Croft (Henry Morgan) ride into a small Nevada town plagued by cattle thieves. Initially suspected of being the rustlers themselves, Carter and Croft eventually join a posse out to get the criminals, who also may be involved in a recent shooting. When the posse closes in on a group that could be the fugitives, they must decide on a course of action, with numerous lives hanging in the balance.

programme.title: Brave Warrior
programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: Rio Conchos
programme.desc: When a shipment of repeating rifles is stolen from the U.S. Cavalry, Capt. Haven (Stuart Whitman) and Sgt. Franklyn are sent to recover them and enlist the aid of an alcoholic former confederate and Indian hater, James Lassiter (Richard Boone) and a Mexican murderer, Rodriguez (Tony Franciosa). Lassiter, who owns one of the rifles, says it came from his embittered former commander Col. Pardee, while an Apache woman informant reveals that Pardee intends to sell the stolen arms to her people.

programme.title: The Tall T

programme.title: Winchester '73
programme.desc: Lin McAdam (James Stewart) pursues notorious outlaw Henry "Dutch" Brown (Millard Mitchell) into Dodge City, Kansas. There, in an effort to flush out the criminal, McAdam enters a sharp-shooting contest and wins the top prize: the eponymous Winchester rifle. Brown, desiring the rifle for himself, sneaks into McAdam's room and makes off with it. After finding the rifle missing, McAdam chases Brown across the state and toward an epic confrontation.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: The Return of Frank James
programme.desc: When Jesse James's murderers are set free, his brother Frank vows revenge and, accompanied by his gang, sets out to track them down. To fund his manhunt, he robs an express office and is subsequently wrongly accused of the clerk's murder, but a newspaper reporter is determined to find out the truth.

programme.title: The Gunfighter
programme.desc: Jimmy Ringo (Gregory Peck) is a veteran gunslinger known for being quick on the draw, but his talent inevitably leads to trouble, with others constantly out to challenge him. All Ringo wants is to be reunited with his estranged family, but he has to contend with various foes, including the ambitious young sharpshooter Hunt Bromley (Skip Homeier). As Ringo attempts to reconcile with his wife, Peggy (Helen Westcott), he finds that he can't easily shake his violent past.

programme.title: Kid Blue
programme.desc: Outlaw Kid Blue (Dennis Hopper) decides to give up robbing trains and go straight. Moving to the small town of Dime Box, Texas, under the name of Bickford Warner, he takes any honest work he can find. With the help of a preacher (Peter Boyle) and Reese Ford (Warren Oates), a friend he makes at the local factory, it seems that Bickford may finally be turning his life around. But for Bickford, hard work just may be too hard, especially when there are plenty of trains to rob.

programme.title: Smoky
programme.desc: Cowboy Clint Barkley (Fess Parker) domesticates a wild horse, quickly forming a bond with "Smoky," but his hated brother joins the staff at the ranch owned by Julie Richards (Diana Hyland) and soon plans to use the horse as a means of paying a debt. Smoky escapes, and Clint searches in vain for the escaped animal. Clint joins the service during World War II, and when he gets back home he finds Smoky, sadly realizing that the horse has met with some bad fortune in his absence.

programme.title: Buffalo Bill
programme.desc: This Western loosely reimagines the life of legend William "Buffalo Bill" F. Cody (Joel McCrea), covering everything from his friendship with the Cheyenne to his rise to fame after journalist Ned Buntline (Thomas Mitchell) romanticized his exploits. Later in his life, Cody falls into obscurity in the wake of controversy and tragedy involving his wife, Louisa (Maureen O'Hara), and their son. He eventually regains his celebrity, however, when he joins a popular Wild West--themed sideshow.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: The Shepherd of the Hills
programme.desc: In the Ozark Mountains a stranger, Daniel Howitt (Harry Carey), inexplicably helps several locals experiencing difficulties. Grateful, Sammy Lane (Betty Field) suggests that Daniel, who wants to settle in the area, buy land next to the Matthews family. Young Matt Matthews (John Wayne) is embittered over the stranger's suspicions concerning the mysterious death of his mother years ago. Mistrustful of Daniel, Young Matt soon learns that the older man is no stranger to his family.

programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: My Darling Clementine
programme.desc: In the middle of a long cattle drive, Wyatt Earp (Henry Fonda) and his brothers stop off for a night in the town of Tombstone. The next morning they find their cattle stolen, and one of the brothers is dead. Earp suspects the Clanton family, owners of the O.K. Corral, but wants his revenge to be legal. He becomes sheriff of Tombstone and forges a rough peace with an alcoholic gambler, Doc Holiday (Victor Mature). Earp also takes a liking to Holiday's former girlfriend, Clementine (Cathy Downs).

programme.title: The Shepherd of the Hills
programme.desc: In the Ozark Mountains a stranger, Daniel Howitt (Harry Carey), inexplicably helps several locals experiencing difficulties. Young Matt Matthews (John Wayne) is embittered over the stranger's suspicions concerning the mysterious death of his mother years ago. programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: Bounty hunter Ben Brigade (Randolph Scott) is on his way to California with his prisoner, Billy John (James Best), who is unaware that Brigade is really after his brother, Frank (Lee Van Cleef). The pair stop at a frontier post and and find themselves defending the poorly guarded settlement from a Native American assault. When the widow Mrs. Lane (Karen Steele) decides to accompany them to Santa Cruz, Brigade enlists the aid of two outlaws who may have a hidden agenda of their own.

programme.title: The Tall Men
programme.desc: Ben (Clark Gable) and Clint (Cameron Mitchell) Allison have been hired to lead a herd of cattle from Texas to Montana. Before long, they see a tribe of Native Americans raiding a small pioneer village. The brothers save the spirited Nella Turner (Jane Russell) and romantic sparks immediately fly between Nella and Ben. However, Nella's desire for wealth puts a damper on their burgeoning relationship. Meanwhile, the cattle drivers must make one last trip through unwelcoming native territories.

programme.title: Yankee Fakir
programme.desc: Yankee Davis (Douglas Fowley) and his partner, professor Newton (Ransom Sherman), are a pair of traveling hucksters on their way to a town in Arizona. Soon after they arrive, Yankee falls for a local girl, Mary Mason (Joan Woodbury). Mary's lawman father turns up dead, and Yankee is sure the man was murdered, but the death is ruled an accident. Believing something's off, Yankee has an elderly associate, Shaggy (Clem Bevans), pose as a rich man and offer a reward for clues about the killing.

programme.title: Warlock
programme.desc: Hired to protect a small mining town in Utah, gunslinger Clay Blaisedell (Henry Fonda) and his devoted follower, Tom Morgan (Anthony Quinn), partake in numerous liberties afforded by their position of power. While Blaisedell and Morgan match the violence of the outlaws they fight, the local inhabitants desire more peaceful resolutions to the crime problem. When reformed thug Johnny Gannon (Richard Widmark) takes the post of sheriff, he finds himself in competition with the town's hired guns.
